error,: You have done a great job, {playername}, without a doubt this shall help us greatly in figuring out the enemy's plans.
What do you want now?
Would there be any particular reason why you disturb me?
Greetings, what brings you here?
I come on the orders of General Kosciuszko, the Chief and the Overseer of the insurrection against the Targowica Confederacy
The General expects, you to join the insurrection on our side.
We will not disappoint. Tell them, they can count on us.
[]I have no tasks for you at the moment, but stick around for now.
Howdy {playername}, good, thing you're here. Apologies, that I didn't elaborate on the issue in the letter, but it might have fallen into the wrong hands and betrayed our plans.

Without any further delay, you must travel to Rzeczpospolita with utmost haste. As Niemcewicz reports in his letters that a couple of days ago, an insurrection broke out. As such, you should expect leadership over one of the regiments.
Thanks to your help, we too are on the brink of armed rebellion against the Habsburg tyranny.  Farewell, {playername}, and keep an eye out for news from these parts. We will be talked about.
As soon as you're ready to take further action, let me know.
I am ready now.
I will be ready soon.
As soon as you're ready to take further action, let me know.
I am ready now.
I will be ready soon.
As soon as you're ready to take further action, let me know.
I am ready now.
I will be ready soon.
I've brought you your comrade.
I regret to inform you, sir , that I did not manage to carry out the mission.
You did not manage to bribe the first amongst the most corruptible officers of the Tsar's army? You have disappointed me greatly, {playername}.
The mission was a success.I give my word, that no-one escaped alive.
Ha! I knew, you would manage to take care of this task. Now I know, that the praises sung about you were not baseless.
The attack on the convoy has not succeeded.they had more men than we thought at the time and our forces were routed.
Those are bad news you are bearing, and far from encouraging regarding our future as those weapons were intended for fresh volunteers. May it be the last defeat on our way to independence.
The convoy had been captured along with the supplies.
Excellent news! It will surely help my men's morale and encourage people to join our ranks.
I see you have returned. Pray tell, then, what brings you here?
I report, that the deserters' forces turned out to have been overwhelming, and despite all attempts, we have faltered. They, in turn, have fled, not awaiting our second attack.
Sooner or later I will find them. A pity about the stolen money, though, it would have helped us greatly.
I see you have returned. Pray tell, then, what brings you here?
I have proclaimed the manifestos in nearby taverns.
Good news you bear {playername}, and ease the burden of my service as I cannot reach everyone, and thus, thanks to you, the enlightened thought will reach every household in the vicinity!
[PLACEHOLDER] I have failed.
[PLACEHOLDER] You gotta be kidding me...
Finally you're back! I've been worried sick, that I sent you to your perdition! Say, how did things go?
I bring good news, without any trouble I've supplied the insurgents with weapons.
Praise be to the Almighty! You have done a splendid job, {playername}. Keep the good work up.
They're safe and sound.
I've been thinking they, they might have been executed already. But you, you couldn't fail! Good fortune has brought you before me.

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_start:qst_egzekucja_end_fail|Sadly, I did not manage to stop the execution. The conspirators were executed.,

error,: Let us entrust their souls to God in prayer. Tis a bad day for me and our cause.
That's all, my son. There is no other way you could help me. Let us not forget, however, that there are others to whom you could be of great use.
I heard, that in the mountainous terrains near Budapest, insurgent divisions are being formed. Travel there and support them with your talents. May the God be with you.

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_etap_2_end_check:iietapidk|That's all you could help me with, {playername}. Myself and my troops have to move the camp into a more convenient place., Recently a lot of patrols showed up in the area.
dlga_iietapidk:close_window|You, meanwhile, move on., People have reported to me, that near Kosice the insurgent divisions are being organized. Farewell.

error,: It's time, {playername}. Recently a messenger arrived with a letter from Martinovics. I've sent him off towards Debrecen, "but, it seems, you must have missed each other.",
Go that way, you will certainly reach him. He has an important message for you.
Watch out for yourself. Farewell, {playername}.
Halt! Say quickly who you are!
If you are a deserter, or worse yet a spy, "we have orders to execute you. Right here, right now, ", without a court.
I am {playername}, a nobleman from the Commonwealth.
I come on orders of the conspiracy leader, Ignac Martinovics.
Whaddya lookin' for? Doncha know, it's no time for visits? Comin' for a confession, wait in the hall for the evening service.a nie głowę zawraca.
I am {playername}, a nobleman and friend of Ignac Martinovics.  I come to you with a political matter.
Mother of God! The politicals again! ^I told the parson, to send you all packing, "you'll only bring misfortune, ", is what I say.
Why d'you be standing around like that? Come in, if you must.
Greetings, I'm {playername}, Martinovics trusted man.
Martinovics's? I am filled with worries, hearing that name.

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_priest_first_meet2:priest_first_meet3|I nonetheless welcome you, son, as though you were one of my parishers. I am Ferenc Bartok, the parson of this place, "and the first exorcist in the Kosice diocese, ", which not without pride I confess to you.

error,: And if you are from Martinovics, I know why you have come here. For now, let's claim, "that you're my nephew, visiting your sick uncle in need", to ease the hardships of his life.
Regarding the last one, "you will not be far from truth and maintain clear conscience, ", as you have arrived for this very purpose. Come back as soon as you're ready.we have a lot of work to do.
Glory be, I see, "you are ready, ", listen then.

As you know, we need to attract the peasantry to the insurrection, but without the proclamation of liberties and promising them freedom, in no way it could succeed. You will take the manifesto and proclaim it in nearby taverns.
Watch out, however, the enemy patrols the area and the Tsar's emissaries don't potter around either. Set out as soon as possible.

Not to brag excessively, I have managed to recruit more than a few of my flock to the fight against the Habsburg tyranny. Many a peasant, following my word and direction, left their villages and set out along with the volunteers to spread the news and rouse the populace to the fight.

I pray for them daily, " and I know that the Mother of God and the angels in the heavens above are watching out for them. While it is of immense aid, ", " without a gun or a sabre, ", my flock will assuredly be torn apart by wolves.

You shall therefore go to them and deliver the weaponry, "which I procured from smugglers and, with no small effort, stockpiled here. Look out for the patrols and the army, however - ", "should they discover the cargo, you will assuredly be lost.",
You come in the right time, as you should know, that three men of great import for our further plans have been captured. They are to be executed in Derecen.
It is thus necessary, for you to set out with haste and prevent the execution. May the Almighty keep you under His protection!
Howdy good sir.
Please excuse the suspiciousness of my men, but not once, nor twice, Tsarists sent spies here.
Ha! Each and every one confessed in the end. All it took was heating a bunch of coals and seating the miscreant on them. Ah, so much fun haha.
But you I trust, I recognize the stamp and I know, "you are Martinovics's. Make yourself at home in the camp and, as soons as you're ready", I will be waiting here with the orders.
There you are at last! I was about to send people to Vienna, to check if you have been captured.
What's with the emissary? Is he alive?

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_qst_rozpoznanieogniem_end2:qst_rozpoznanieogniem_end_good|Alive, as you suspected, "he was being tailed. They attacked as we were trying to get out of the city, but neither he", nor me were hurt, the others in turn received quite a beating.
dlga_qst_rozpoznanieogniem_end_good:qst_rozpoznanieogniem_4|Good news for us! ^ I don't have one for you, though, {playername}.,

error,: Bad news. They were laying in wait and attacked as we were trying to flee the city. Sadly, The emissary died in the fight.
Bad news for us indeed, "we've lost a contact in Vienna itself! Regardless, ", {playername}, I have worse news for you.

Tsarists already know about your part in the conspiracy -, it seems you were being followed too, especially since, "that day in the tavern you've messed up their plans big time, ", as Niemcewicz did not omit in his letter.
You are thus in grave danger, possibly having not only Habsburg spies, but also the Russian ones. One thing for sure, you must leave Budapest today.

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_qst_rozpoznanieogniem_6:qst_rozpoznanieogniem_7|I will give you a letter of recommendation for the conspiracy leaders in other parts of the country. You've proven your skills here, , your aid may prove priceless for them too.

error,: Prepare for the departure, "the sooner you set out the better. They might send some men your way. Farewell, {playername}."
Get moving quickly, {playername}, the orders mustn't wait.
You're here at last.
{playername}, the scouts reported, that nearby a local village an enemy patrol was spotted.
Find them and kill them all, lest they spot our camp and bring more troops in.
There's still too few of us to face the army. Soon, however, all of that will change and we will be able to avenge our grievances!
Our men are preparing an ambush nearby. A convoy from Pest is going to Debrecen. They are allegedly transporting supplies and weapons.
Go and support them. We cannot afford too many losses, and the food will help us survive.

Though it embarasses me to admit, not all volunteers turn out to be as devoted to the patriotic cause as you, {playername}. Recently a bunch of men from my troop fled under the cover of the night taking weapons and horses with them.
Worse yet, Blackguards, stole the money we confiscated from a Tsar's commissioner bearing the wages for one of the regiments.
I suppose, They have hidden somewhere nearby. Find them, shoot them dead and try to recover the money.
Greetings, the name is {playername}. You’re the one called Ignac Martinovics, if I am correct?

Indeed it is. Your arrival was expected. Not to beat around the bush, Niemcewicz portrayed you as a man of great talents and , more importantly, a fine soldier able to stand unflinchingly against a dozen hussarshowever
I find that hard to believe, I am however certain, that you can be of great use. I trust, that soon we will have an opportunity to test that.
You are free to take your leave now, return when you are ready to take orders.
Your rival, good sir, has lost to me in the duel. And soon afterwards, he lost his life.
Really?! Excellent news! No longer shall he interfere with my plans.
I regret to admit, I did not manage to defeat your rival, m'lord. The blackguard won the duel by an underhanded trick!
The witnesses' judgement begs to differ... But nevermind. I will find someone, better fit for that mission.
I will be waiting for you, come, when you're ready.
Back already? Splendid.^ Listen well, then.

You see {playername}, we've sent emissaries around the country, to spread revolutionary ideals among the common men. I have recently learned, "however that one of our men acting in Vienna, is under vigilant observation by the enemy. This means", that he might be captured at any time now.

There is no way we can allow this to happen.Travel to Wiednia and aid in his flight. He lives in the suburbs, in the local brothel, upstairs. Rozumiesz waszmość... zasady konspiracji. Rozpoznasz bez trudu gdzie to jest.
It's likely the entire area is filled to the brim with spies, so act during the night, silently and as discreetly as possible.
One of our men has been captured in Debrecen while smuggling weapons. He is to be executed soon.Do all you can to set him free.
The officer in charge of executions is one bribable son of a bitch. Here is the money for the transaction.You should be able to buy out our man, without any great effort.
The execution will take place soon.so you must set out as soon as you can. Remember, to keep things discreet.

You need to know, that there is a certain man, "who has made it his mission to slander me. It is unacceptable for me, ", "being at the position I am, ", to tolerate his insults and untruthful accusations.

The man in question, is an old rival of mine, "who paid suit to the same lady I did. Of course, ", the lady chose me. The villain couldn't stomach the rejection and he visits his rage and frustrations, to this very day!

Keeping my position in mind, I cannot challenge him to a duel. However, you, being from a distant country... Have a dispute with him and challenge him to a duel. I want you to get rid of the weasel once and for all. Do it for the sake of the uprising, you know after all how much harm he could do us.
I thought so. I will be awaiting the news.
Hail, sir.
Do we know each other? I don't seem to recall...
{playername}? So be it, greetings.
I hope, I do not disturb you m'lord?
Not in the slightest.
If I do, please tell me. I would hate to disturb.

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_zniewaga_7:zniewaga_8|You don't disturb me one bit, , stand here as long as you desire.
dlga_zniewaga_8:zniewaga_9|Ah, there you see good sir! I can clearly hear in your voice that I am unpleasant to you! And after all, I did ask if I was disturbing you!

error,: Let me ask again: do I disturb you?
Bloody hell, enough of that, are you out of your mind?
Ha! I knew it! First you tell me, "that I'm not a disturbance, ", only to cast insults at me later!
Enough is enough! I'm gonna knock some sense into you!
Have at you!
I will be waiting for you... try to make sure, you don't give me an unwelcome surprise.

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_start:close_window.8|I will be on the lookout for you, , but it's time you left. Go with God.

error,: Eh? What?

error,: Oof, "close call, ", if we were less lucky we'd have been tortured tomorrow. Thank you for your warning and aid in my escape, sir.
We must part here, there is little point for me to return to {s20}, so I shall set out to the east and try to rouse the people there. Farewell.
Who are you?! What the hell are you looking for?

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_qemis2:qemis3|You better be quiet sir, lest you want to wake everyone up in this establishment. Ignac Martinovics sent me., mam was zabrać stąd czym prędzej.

You are free.

Thank god! To whom do we owe our lives?
I am {playername}.^,
Thank you, {playername}. We shall remain your debtors.
One of the convicts is innocent.

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_execution_quest:execution_quest2|Innocent?! Even I am not without guilt, , and this blackguard, who raised his hand on a soldier, certainly isn't! A lieutenant in the service of Tsar himself, to boot!

error,: He deserves it, as the devil himself. He'll die right here and now, that's it!
I insist you let him go. I'm even ready to make some necessary expenses...
Trying to bribe a Tsar's officer, are you?! What a rascal! Dear lord, where do such people come from?
I ought to put you right next to those here, but know, that my heart is soft, and my pay far from generous.
You will give me 700 zlotys for the life of that villain and the both of you will get the hell out of here.
Pleasure doing business with you, sir.
700?! You must be out of your mind, it's a fortune!
Goodness gracious! Bartering for the life of a comrade!
The agreement is null and void.Get him!
What do you want?! Stand back or you will join those traitors!
We're dealing out justice here, what are you looking for here?
I demand you free these men.
You have chosen your fate, then. Get him!
[Leave],
Anything new in politics?
Ah, go to hell.
Any rumors to be heard on the roads and in taverns?
Nothing in particular.
Nothing, goodbye.
Goodbye.
What are people talking about lately?
Nothing.
Nothing, goodbye.
Goodbye.
fafffffffffffff,

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_start:kosciuszko_3etapend|Hello, {s20}! I must admit you, have done a splendid job carrying out the orders. Your role in the fight and your dedication will not go in vain. For your services, I would like to reward you with a promotion. You are now {s68}.

error,: Good day, {s68} I've been awaiting your arrival.

As you probably know, the war will soon begin. Neither the Prussian King, nor Empess Catherine are willing to negotiate. The loss of rulership in the Commonwealth would have been a hit to the authority of monarchy and lead to internal conflicts. As such we can be certain, they will use all forces at their disposal, to kill our independence.

Regarding Habsburgs, they are busy fighting the revolt in Hungary and the war against the revolutionary France, to such a degree that, we need not worry about them. We have emissaries in both Hungary and even Vienna, however, and if this was to change we are certainly going to learn of that earlier.

Regarding Habsburgs, we should anticipate the attack from that side as well. As the emissaries report, their forces are limited, by the revolt in Hungary and the war against the revolutionary France. Nonetheless, we must remain prepared.

Therefore, we need to take decisive actions. You, along with your regiment, will support our troops in particularly endangered areas. You will also take care of sabotage in the lands under enemy control. These lands were taken from us illegally. You may count on the support of the people there.
I report, that, {playername}. We shall remain your debtors.
Excellent, lieutenant. Report in as soon as you're ready to take further orders.
{s68}, what do you have to report?

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_kosciuszko_onquest:close_window|I have captured Ensign Swistacki and, as per order, I bring him to you, General.

error,: I am currently carrying out the orders.
Splendid. I will be awaiting news of your progress.
fafffffffffffff,
Greetings, I'm {playername}. I come on the orders of the Chief.aby odebrać powierzony mi regiment.

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_werbownik_first_meet:werbownik_first_meet2|Welcome, , so you are the crafty young man, who was Kosciuszko's emissary to Hungary? Congratulations on your heretofore victories and the promotion.

error,: The regiment is ready to march out at any time. If you need anything else, you know where to find me.
I'm here about the regiment.
Nevermind, goodbye.
You know the best.
Do you have any challenges for me?

It is said, that the best swordsman in the Commonwealth, "and who knows, perhaps the entirety of Europe, is {s20}. Allegedly, he's a lazy drunkard", How could someone like this be so famed?^ If you want to make me proud of you, fight him, may the people say, at least briefly, that you are the finest swordsman in the Commonwealth!
win 3 sabre duels,
win 3 pistol duels,
No, I don't.
I need some money.
So be it, that's all I have.
I gave you money, no further than a couple days ago, I don't have any anymore.
I really need them.
So be it, that's all I have.
I cannot, for now.
[Give up],
I would like to end our relationship.
Excuse me? Are you unwell, {playername}?
No, I feel weak, call the barber please.
After all of this? Over? You would treat me so? You're gonna, regret it, now get out of here.I don't want to see you anymore.
Yes.It's over.
I doubt it, goodbye my dear.
Farewell and be safe.
Well, time for me to go.
Show me your wares.
Nothing, goodbye.
do uzupełnienia,
I've talked to your son, he's young, but he has a great spirit and the ability to serve the homeland greatly. Give him your blessing and pray for him and the Commonwealth.
I'm sorry, but I did not manage to persuade him out of his plans.
I've manage to persuade you son, at least so as to, consider staying home...
I've succeeded, the son will remain home.
Oh, damn you, I knew it would end like that... that rascal is a real pain. Farewell.
This will do, here's the half of the money. That's how much you earned.
Truly?! How have you done it? Ah, nevermind. I wholeheartedly thank you! Take this purse, five hundred, no less. May they serve you well.
Your father sent me.
All my friends are joining the volunteer companies, infantry and cavalry, one even joined the artillery... and me? I'm supposed to stay at home with old ladies?
You are right, but so are your father's worries.
Your father's worries are justified - what will he do if you don't return, "or return a cripple? They need you, boy. It will be hard for them to survive in the uncertain times..."
Well, you have a point... tell my father that I will stay, at least until summer, maybe longer.
Hmm... you have a point. But I cannot resign now, I've signed everything already. Tell father, however, that I'll think of it. I'm not saying I will stay, but I have to think about it. Now go.
Really? I'm sorry, but I cannot resign now...
I've seen war many times.

I've seen war many times, barely made it alive from many a battle, often victorious, but I know how many people lost their lives. So don't be surprised that your father wants to keep you by his side. Death on the battlefield comes easily, believe me, especially since I'm a man experienced in these matters. You've likely heard of me many times...
Indeed, I've heard many times of your victories, as a matter of fact...
Eh? Who are you that I should have heard about? Please.
You are in the right.
Finally, a reasonable man! Now go back to my father and tell him that.
Well, if you said so, I'll be off then.
So be it, I rest my case, however consider it well in your conscience.
I knew you are a reasonable man. Believe me, it's better that way.
Right, and tell him not to sent anyone anymore... I'm tired of their persuasions, bribery and misguided argumentations.
I will certainly do so - and relay that to my father.
Better not, especially for the Fatherland... but as you said, "I must stay and defend the family. Relay the news to my father, please.",
The tales don't measure up to reality, I see.
Tell them, I will consider staying home, but that's all I can promise.
Tell my father that, for now, I will stay, and we'll see what future brings later.
I am busy right now, goodbye.
Eh, you again? Don't bore me.
Leave, would you kindly?

I am looking for a certain Ensign Swistacki, would you happen to have welcomed such a person here? He's a man of large frame, built like brick shithouse. I wanted to have a drink with an old companion, and I cannot find him now...
Ensign Swistacki? Hmm, I've heard something, but for the life of me I cannot remember now... you see, I just cook food and wash the tankards every Saint Vitus, what could I have seen here?
Perhaps this will refresh your memories. (5 zloty),
I will come back later then.
Hmm... indeed, I think I'm starting to remember!
I've seen such a man, he was travelling along the road to {s21}. Pretty recently, when I was opening the tavern, if you set out now, you will catch up with him.
I've seen such a man, he was here {reg21} days ago and departed towards {s21}. I don't know anymore about him, or his destination for that matter.

No, that was not the man. He was short and thin and didn't seem like an ensign at all, more like a deserter, and we have more than enough of these lowlifes. So no, your friend was not here. Anything I should tell him if he shows up?
That's my companion! I'll catch up with him on the road, farewell.
Then I shall continue to look for him, farewell.
No, and certainly don't mention, that I've been looking for him. I want it to be a surprise.
They serve excellent drinks in this here establishment, would you like to have one?
I surrender, I am your prisoner.
Agreed, let's fight.
Let us begin.
Gladly.
I would like to know who I have the pleasure of meeting first.
Excuse me not introducing myself. I'm officer [INSERT NAME HERE], from [TROOP NAME]. I'm travelling with a report to Krakow.
To Krakow? Who are you looking for?
General Kosciuszko, I'm supposed to deliver the message in person.
You are lying.
Lies! As it happens the Chief has been away from Krakow for the last month. Would you please explain that?
You're calling me a liar?! You'll pay for that. ^ Stand and deliver, we'll fight with rapiers!
You're calling mea liar?! You'll pay for that. ^ Stand and deliver, we'll fight with pistols!
I know enough, let's drink.
Let's have a drink, before we hit the road.
Before I take the manacles out, speak, who are you?
Are you feeble-minded? Should I call a barber?
That's no way to talk to an officer.
Be quiet! And speak! Who are you, and where from, or else.
I've been dabbling in sciences, astronomy, physics, didn't mind medicine either... if you need bloodletting, just say the word.
You won't get away with this! Stand and deliver.

Be my witnesses, ten oto człowiek mieniący się oficerem wyzwał mnie na szable that this here man, calling himself an officer, has challenged me to a duel, not the other way around...^ pistols czy rapiers?
Pistols,
Rapiers,
Hey, you there! Halt!
Be you Ensign Swistacki?
Maybe I am, maybe I'm not. What's your business?
{s69} {playername}, I come with an order from the Chief.
You are under arrest for desertion. You will go with me to Chief Kosciuszko now.
You dare speak to me like that?! A hero of the battle in Raclawice?! How dare you!
Now just a deserter. We're off.
Greetings, look just who it is! I didn't expect to see you here. Glad to see you, old friend. I see, you've gotten a rank and a nice regiment, congratulations.
Hello. Seems like you're an officer too. It's an honor.
nie ma tego,

Right, I've been lucky as well... ^Warm day today, my throat feels dry. What would you say we go to the nearby tavern for a drink or two? I heard, they have excellent beer there, just right for a chat.
Now's not the right moment, we need to talk.
You see, "I got an order to arrest a man wandering around, claiming to be an officer. Sadly", everything points to you and there is no way it could be a mistake.
{playername}, we've known each other for a long time, I won't deny what you're saying, just allow me to explain myself.

Some time ago I and madam X, a lady close to my heart, were at a ball held by one of the magnates and one of the most hardline Targowica backers. There was a lot of Targowica supporters, as well as a lot of Russian officers. I was to eavesdrop and overhear as much as I could.
Not all went according to my plan, someone recognized me and captured us. What was I to do when they threatened X? I had to take their conditions.
In exchange for her life they demanded I spy for them in a disguise of an officer. Which is why I'm in this place.
I will help you.
I can help you.
How could you? As soon as I stop sending in the reports, they will kill her.
To accomplish anything, you have to be free, first.
What can we do?
We'll find someone to take your place.
I'll find some lowlife and send him in your stead. You will wait here, meanwhile, and I'll be back in a couple of days.
You will give me your uniform as a proof of your death.
You will give me your uniform, I will take it along with the message of your demise. You will meanwhile wait here, I'll be back in a few days.
Agreed {playername}, I will wait, but no longer than a couple of days.
I understand, but it changes nothing.
I understand, but I cannot allow private interests from triumph over the good of the nation.
I will not waste my chance of saving X.
I am to duel with a convict?
There's no other solution, let's end this here and now.
I'll give you the possibility of choice, pistols or rapiers?
Pistols.
Rapiers.
I don't want to fight.
Allow me to explain, then.
Let us begin, if there's no other way for us.
I am to drink with a traitor?
I see, our paths didn't cross by accident. Won't you ask for the reason?
I'm not interested in the reason.
Bad choice {playername}. I cannot waste my chance of saving X. I see but one path for us. A duel.
I give you the possibility of choice, pistols or rapiers?
Pistols.
Rapiers.
What X are you talking about?
Speak quickly.
Hmm... if you insist, then let's go. I would like to rest in a {s0} tavern. Do you have anything against that?
Not at all. I would gladly empty a tankard or two. Let's go.
New taxes.
Allegedly new taxes are to be introduced, according to my uncle's friend, and he's a full-blooded beaurocrat, he knows everything, about what, how and when.
Whatever, I'm only here in passing.
Ban on the weapon trade.
My uncle told me, and he's a high-ranked beaurocrat, that the government plans to introduce new taxes on imports and gunsmiths, so that they couldn't sell weapons cheaply.
Really? Goddamn, I'm lucky, I'm well-stocked on weapons. But either way, I'll tell the other noblemen to arm themselves just in case.
The revocation of the impoverished nobility's rights.
My uncle told me, and he's a high-ranked beaurocrat, that the government plans to take away the impoverished nobility's right, apparently to prevent revolts.
What?! This cannot be! How could they, it's a scandal! That is sure to result in a riot! Thank you for the news, I will rush to inform everyone who needs to be informed.
My uncle told me, and he's a high-ranked beaurocrat, that the government plans to introduce new taxes on imports and gunsmiths, so that they couldn't sell weapons cheaply.
Bandits! We will not allow them to rob us of more than they already do! We'd sooner take up the arms! Thank you for the information, I will make sure to inform other merchants and townsmen!
Ban on trade.

It is said around the city, that there will be a ban on trade, or at least a crackdown on the liberties, to eliminate shady weapons and alcohol trading. They say the wares of a couple of merchants were already comandeered.
A ban on trade?! How could they, they will ruin us all completely, my whole family lives on what I earn from trade. But we'll show the bastards!
Law changes.
Allegedly the law is about to change and they will ban public assembly for now... that's what my uncle told me, and he knows what's going on around.
May they have to stand in line for some room in hell! Divine punishment will come to them, rest assured.
One of my high-ranked friends told me, they are about to introduce new taxes on common goods and textiles.niedobrze dzieje się w państwie...
New ones? They wanted riots, they will get riots! We won't be paying more than we already are!
Ban on trade.

It is said around the city, that there will be a ban on trade, or at least a crackdown on the liberties, to eliminate shady weapons and alcohol trading. They say the wares of a couple of merchants were already comandeered.
Eh, "the populace sure won't allow it. I'll tell anyone I met what you said, though."
They say, that the rights of the local people are about to be limited, apparently a law is about to be passed, as my uncle told me, and he's really knowledgeable in these matters.
They can't limit it more than it already is, and thank God, I'm not a local anyway.
You've done better than I expected... report our victory to the camp.
Ha, it was to be expected, we'd lose with support like that... report our defeat to the camp.
Mister commander, I don't want a rebellion, I'm fighting on, not getting enough sleep or food for a wage like that. The times are hard so I don't complain much.

But hell, I'll be damned, if I have to tolerate these boors from the forest one more day! They drink surreptitiously and steal our food when we sleep, the bastards! With all respect that is your due, I ask for an intervention, after all you don't want us to take care of it ourself, do you?
Thank you once more...
Doing business with you, {playername}, is a real pleasure.
Splendid job. If you need anything else, you can count on me...
[Appeal to honor],
Not a drop of honor in you, it seems, it's clear you're not of a noble birth.

Leave your ivory tower. Horses, knights or tournaments are a thing of the past. And just have a look at where the „honorable” nobility has led the Commonwealth. May the devil torment them for a thousand years.
[Appeal to credibility],
You'd better recall quickly, else nobody will ever lend you anything again.
Well, well. Speak more quietly, will you? I'm paying it back, without the interest, but the borrowed sum to a penny. That's all I can afford.
[Appeal to renown],
You'd better recall and just think, what will people say about you if you don't pay back.
Everyone talks whatever they damn want and nothing ever comes out of that, so why bother?
Damn you to hell! Here's the debt alone, I borrowed so much, I give back so much, and don't come back again, or I'll let the dogs out.
Damn you to hell! Here's the money and the interest, as was arranged.
I may not be of great birth, but I'm of sound mind. You won't get a thing from me!
When the news comes around that you don't pay back, who will lend you the money in the future?
Eh, so be it, here's the sum I borrowed. I don't have anything else, and besides, no more is owed.
Pay back, and nobody knows you're as insoluable as a Greek bank.
I care not what the people say, tell whoever you want.
Yes, yes, I remember, here's the debt... sadly without the interest, but I have nothing more...
Yes, yes, I remember, here's the debt and the interest.
You don't have a drop of honor, forgetting a debt just like that?
Pah, I care not for that, just want to have a livelihood. Look at him, a veritable knight... three lions on the shield, two shitting, one growling
So be it, "I'll take care of it myself, then."
Here you go, and be quiet about this. I always pay my debts. Without the usurious interest, of course, that's against the God's will... everyone will tell you so.
Goddamn loansharks... fine, here's the borrowed money.  To a penny. I won't give anything more, because I have no more,
Goddamn loansharks...  here's the money and the interest, as was arranged.
I see, that a nobleman's honor no more is prized...
Damn you, here's the debt, that's how much I borrowed and that's how much I will pay back. And the service will be returned in Heaven... if Saint Peter lets that bloody usurer pass.
So you don't care about your credibility...

Greetings, {s69} {playername}? I welcome the first among the Rzeczypospolita's emissaries with pleasure. You have done a great job assisting Hungarians' efforts in preparing the revolt and your efforts will not be in vain, as news are flowing from Hungary of an upcoming, armed insurgency against Habsburgs' rule.

Greetings, {s69} {playername}? It is good to see you, I heard, that as an emissary you have bravely supported the Hungarians in the preparations for the revolt. Although not all goals were fulfilled, "jednak wkrótce możemy oczekiwać zbrojnego wystąpienia przeciw tyranii Habsburskiej. we can still expect an armed insurrection against the Habsburg tyranny, ",

Greetings, {s69} {playername}? It is good to see you, I heard, that as an emissary you have bravely supported the Hungarians in the preparations for the revolt. Unfortunately, your engagement did not produce the effects desired. According to the latest news, the plan of the revolt needs to be delayed.

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_kosciuszko_first_talk2:close_window|For your services, I promote you to a Lieutenant. Before you set off make sure to gather new soldiers., nieopodal stąd jest obóz wojskowy. Melduj się później u mnie.

error,: I have already handed over the scoundrel to the city watch.
I have dealt out the justice to the traitors.
At ready.
Goodbye.

Just like that? Where's the sentence? Where a tribunal? How am I to fight for liberty and justice, "when my own officer cannot execute an order properly? I thought you are better than this, {playername}..."
Excellent, that's just what I expected of you!
Then listen well, after we've taken the cities, many Targowica traitors will attempt to hide of flee the Rzeczypospolita. But they're gonna need help.
Go to the cities, after they have been taken by our armies, try to catch at least some of them. Each and every single one you catch is to be handed over to the city watch.
They're gonna have to wait for the end of the insurrection and a just trial in prison.
aaaaa,
{playername}, in an unfortunate turn of event our great ally {s0} had been taken prisoner. As fate would have it, he was abducted by highwaymen on the way from Warsaw to Krakow.

They are waiting for ransom near the tavern 'Rome'. Unfortunately our treasury is empty, so do all you can to rescue him from their hands. It is important he is back and on his position as soon as possible.

See {playername}, the enemy is sending emissaries to our lands trying to turn the peasants against us. I've received a message, "that one of them is currently in a tavern. Capture him and deliver to the prison in Warsaw. If he resists, do not hesitate to eliminate him.",

I have a bit of a problem {playername}, as usual during wartime, a lot of bandits started showing up on the roads lately, but a band led by Grzegorz Opalonko is particularly problematic. Emissaries reported, he is cooperating with Russian troops supporting the Targowica Confederates and report our forces positions and manpower.

It needs to be dealt with. According to the information that reached me, they often stay at the tavern {s20}. Learn where they hide during the day, the ringleader is to be captured and delivered to me alive.
As you know the aim of our fight are not temporary changes or short-term improvement. We need a reform of treasury, army, and before all others providing care and liberties to the peasantry.

It is in their hands that the fate of the Rzeczypospolita lies, if the peasants support the insurrection, not only will the country regain independence, but we will also be able to reach equality of all estates bloodlessly.
It is crucial that the news reach the peasants rapidly, so you will go and read the manifesto in villages.

Since you've taken command of the regiment entrusted to you, you can get ready to go on your way. There's fighting over cities that our of utmost importance to us since several days, but the news of the insurrection has not reached everyone yet. You will go to the fortification of {s20}, finding there a garrison composed of Polish soldiers, tell them the news and the order to join the insurrection.
Watch out, there may be Russian patrols nearby.
In a couple of days we're planning to strike and retake Warsaw from Russian hands, the locals surely will majorly aid us, but that's not all we need, in order to be able to achieve full success.

The orders are, as follows: you will go towards Warsaw. Most likely in the following days there will be fighting nearby and the leades of the Targowica Confederacy will attempt to flee. Capture them and deliver to the capital. They will await their trial there.

And now {playername} I have new orders for you. We need you to capture one of the {s20} officers. Once you accomplish that, bring him here. He will certainly have useful information, that will be of great use during combat...

It is needed to know {playername}, that despite the recent victories, not everything is happening to our liking. A marked demoralization has crept into several troops, resulting in insubordination, and even desertion.

The gravest of those is the disappearance of one of the particularly martial scythemen, a man called Ensign Swistacki. This man, despite having bravely stood and risked his life more than once in the first row, for some time is drifting around and bragging about his deeds, instead of taking care of his duties.
I've sent some men after him, but for no avail. We can no longer allow excesses like that to ruin order, annihilate discipline. Take care of that.
