Unfortunately, no.
None, I must take my leave now, farewell.
I have quite a problem sir, my friends told me, that my wife is getting herself a lover. I need someone to persuade him against it, you know what I mean? I pay well.

I am in no shortage of worries sir, my wife is cuckolding me with some rogue. I've learned, that he has a wife as well, a real harpy and quick to anger. You will deliver her this letter.and she will give him a rough time. He will learn not to reach for what is not his own. I won't have any trouble to find some coin in thanks.
Yes, there is something you can to, here's a letter. Deliver it to the mayor and return, and you'll get something for the errand.
I have a mission of utmost importance, as I'm certain, that {s20}, deliver this note to the watch, and I will reward you well.

You see, my dear {playername}... There happens to be a certain churl in this town, and he happened to turn ruining my reputation into his goal. I'm not gonna allow anyone to mess with me, a nobleman with a pedigree of several generations!

You see my lord, there's a certain man, who decided to ruin my reputation. It is not within my power, to prevent that... help me please, if not for me, then for my family. I will reward your effort well.
{s20}. {s21}, {s22}. We've pleaded with the mother, begged, persuaded, but nothing, no way to get that stupid plan out of her mind. The youngster, dumb and wants a fight...  {s23}..
We've lost one already, two years ago during the war with Russia... don't let us grieve for this one too sir, {s20}... {s21},
I'll take care of that.
Excellent, here's 400 zlotys of downpayment. The rest you'll get once this creature is silent once and for all.
It's not a job for me.
You can count on me.

Recently I've saved some people in need, who sadly turned out to be scoundrels and won't return neither the money, nor the interest we agreed upon. Find them and retrieve the debt, and you can expect a reward. Just get it ALL back, down to a penny!
It's beneath me to act as a moneylender's henchman.
Take care of that, I'll reward you generously.
You can count on me.
That's beneath a nobleman's honor.
No, I have nothing for you.
I'll talk to him.
Serving the fatherland is a glorious thing.
Serving the fatherand is a thing of great glory, I won't persuade your son against things like that.
So be it, I'll talk to him.
I'm sorry, I can't do anything.
[Retrieve the debt],
[Provoke],
Any news going round the town?
Wouldn't you happen to need some help?
Nothing, farewell.
Nothing, I must take my leave now, goodbye.
I don't have the time for that right now, goodbye.
I don't have the time for that right now, goodbye.

The whole area is roaring with gossip lately. Some time ago Austrians thrown to Indyes, it's that old prison under Kamieniec stronghold, mister {s20}. Just like that, for nothing. They accused him of conspiring against the king, scoundrels. We've sent protestations, went to Kamieniec but for naught. We probably won't ever see him anymore.
Heh, they're saying lately, that the girls in the {s20} brothel got the French disease. Stay away from that establishment.
They say, that some disease destroyed the hop plantations and the beer during the next year, will be prized as {s20}, let's hope, that with lower tarrifs our merchants will get some from {s21}.
Last Sunday, mister {s20} of {s21} disappeared without a word, they've seen him in front of the tavern, then near the mill, and then he just disappeared into thin air.

I'll tell you, my uncle told me recently the story, so an alchemist from Gdansk, wossizname... {s20}. He found a new way of {s21} vodka production, looks like a good time for our purses and palates. Not only it's supposed to taste better, and cheaper to boot!

Have you heard, in France a man called Napoleon - last name Bonaparte - was made a general of the brigade. It may not seem important or significant, after all the war is raging there and heads rolling, so you need to replace the cadres... But I'll tell you, that Bonaparte's gonna raise a ruckus, that's as sure as a Venetian banker's money. After all he's ambitious, and skilled alike...
The travellers say, that in France the black man's slavery was abolished forever and ever. What a world, where for some the dawn of freedom is in sight, where for others it's almost dusk...
Allegedly in the faraway Denmark the royal castle in Christianborg burned down. Lucky them, the Danes... the only thing destroying their cultural heritage is the flames.
I don't talk to people not of nobility, goodbye.
Welcome, what do you need of me?
[Retrieve the debt],
[Provoke],
Any news going round the town?
Wouldn't you happen to need some help?
Nothing, farewell
Nothing, I must take my leave now, farewell.
Hullo! What do you need?
[Retrieve the debt],
[Provoke],
Any news going round the town?
Wouldn't you happen to need some help?
Nothing, farewell.
Nothing, I must take my leave now, farewell.
Farewell.
I bow to you sir, how may I serve?
[Retrieve the debt],
[Provoke],
Any news going round the town?
You wouldn't happen to need some help, would you?
Nothing, farewell.
Nothing, czas na mnie, farewell.
Goodbye, I hope we meet again.
NO TEXT,
Yes?
Allegedly someone is trying to take over.
Nothing, Farewell.
I'll pay for information.
Goodbye.
What's up in the camp?
{s20}, what's up in the camp?
Nothing now, goodbye.
Show me what you got.
Nothing, goodbye.
I report, that I managed to suppress the revolt. Luckily, it didn't manage to spread to the rest of the troops.
Excellent news, you've eliminated a major threat to our cause.
Greetings, I'm {playername}.
Welcome. I'm glad you've arrived so quickly, I've receied a letter from mister Jablonowski. He wrote of you as a man of great skills, able to help us greatly.
Take a look around the camp, and when you know th situation, return to me. I'll have orders.
You've done a great job, we'll surely get a lot of information out of him.
Any progress in the mission?
Results will come soon.
I am unfortunately unable to complete the mission.
A shame, I hope the next one is successful.
What do you need of me?
[Retrieve the debt],
[Provoke],
Any news going round the town?
Wouldn't you happen to need some help?
Nothing, farewell.
Oh, that's you, great job. You can now choose, do you want to lead line infantry or light cavalry?
Leading the infantry, an honor in every army.
I always wanted to serve in the cavalry.
Excellent, a company is awaiting orders, and here's your promotion to the rank of Captain.
Excellent, a squadron is awaiting orders, and here's your promotion to the rank of Rotamaster.
Congratulations, now you can choose, do you want to lead infantry or cavalry?
Leading the infantry, an honor in every army.
I always wanted to serve in the cavalry.
Excellent, a battalion is awaiting orders, and here's your promotion to the rank of Major.
Excellent, a regiment is awaiting orders, and here's your promotion to the rank of Major.
To whom am I to be grateful for saving me?
I am {playername}, {s20}.
Nice to meet you {playername}, I hope, that you'll safely deliver me to my home...
Congratulations, now you can choose whether you want to lead infantryor cavalry.
Leading infantry is a honor in every army.
I always wanted to serve in the cavalry.
Excellent, regiment już czeka na rozkazy, and here's your promotion to the rank of kapitana.
Excellent, a brigade is awaiting orders, and here's your promotion to the rank of rotmistrza.
Congratulations, now you can choose, do you want to lead infantry or cavalry?
Leading infantry, that's my vocation.
Cavalry, after all it's hard to resist the power of tradition.
Excellent, a regiment is awaiting orders, and here's your promotion to the rank of Major.
Excellent, a brigade is awaiting orders, and here's your promotion to the rank of Major.
Excellent, a regiment is awaiting orders, and here's your promotion to the rank of Colonel.
Excellent, a brigade is awaiting orders, and here's your promotion to the rank of Colonel.
Excellent, a regiment is awaiting orders, and here's your promotion to the rank of General.
Excellent, a brigade is awaiting orders, and here's your promotion to the rank of Brigadier.

Ah, sir, good to see you! We didn't get an opportunity to say goodbye properly, but I can see, you're healthy and come with company. I always knew, you're a crafty person! As you can see I'm a recruiter here. If you need you can hire regiments and receive promotions, if such come to you. And come to your old friend every now and then!
Hail {playername}, good to see you, will you have a drink or just here for the new men?
Yes, show me, who do you have there.
You're not an officer yet.
Yes, show me, who do you have there.
Nothing, it's time for me to go, farewell.
Gladly, show me what you've got.
I have good news {playername}, negotiations with cossacks are done, soon they will support us.

W pobliżu obozu stawił się pierwszy oddział kozacki pod wodzą Atamana Hołowatego. Wkrótce przeprowadzi atak na Kijów. Zbierz ilu możesz ludzi i rusz razem z nimi. Nie zapomnij, żeby zameldować mi o sukcesie oblężenia.
{s20}, {s68} {playername}, {s21}?
Any orders?
How do you assess the progress of the fight?
Nothing, goodbye.
I can only say, that our situation is very difficult, we're nearing a defeat.
Our situation is difficult, only a wonder can save us from defeat. We lack a well-trained army.
Not to ramble too much, not satisfying, there's still a long journey ahead of us.
We're doing good, let's hope we stay in the offensive.
Getting better, we're in offensive, the opponent is falling back.
I think, that soon the Tsar's diplomats will knock on our doors, of course we will show no mercy.
Check, and as an old soldier, I can tell, soon to be mate.
We're nearing victory, enemy's forces are in a rout.
Czego chcesz ode mnie, pajacu palowany? Wystroił się taki jak małpa w cyrku i myśli, że mu wszystko wolno!
Jestem {playername}, w służbie Naczelnika .... Przychodzę odebrać Ci życie.
Guards! Treason! Help!

{playername}, scouts reported, that close to a village nearby a small troop of the enemy is patrolling. Find them and kill them all.aby naszego obozu nie wypatrzyli i carskiej ekspedycji nie sprowadzili.
First thing we need to do is arm the peasants, you will go find the insurgents and give them the weaponry. Once there's more of us, it'll be easier to think of larger scale operations...

W pobliżu obozu stawił się pierwszy oddział kozacki pod wodzą Atamana, wkrótce zaatakują jedną z fortyfikacji. Musimy zdobyć jakiś przyczółek przed dalszymi walkami. Zbierz ilu możesz ludzi i rusz razem z nimi. Nie zapomnij, żeby zameldować mi o sukcesie oblężenia.
Good, we need to capture the town of {s0}, it will allow us to concentrate a bigger force and give us control, over a large part of Podolia.
Keep close, and together we will capture the stronghold from the enemy's hands.
A mission delicate and demanding a large degree of caution, I've written some manifestoes that must reach the peasants. It's their involvement that can give us an edge over the enemy.
Watch out however, there's still a lot of enemy patrols and emissaries persuading the peasants to give up the revolutionaries...

{playername}, a certain good man has reported to me some time ago, that there's someone among us wishing to take over and replace me. Take care of that, ask around in the camp and as delicately as possible remove him from our ranks. It is unbecoming of an officer, but necessary, when the cause is in danger.
Ask around, learn who that is and take care of that efficiently, such is the fate of all traitors.
There's rumors, that someone has fancied to take over, do you know anything about it,

Yeah well, maybe, maybe not. Here everything is going so fast, not like in my village... a man can't catch up, this one bribes, that one buys some booze, those sound the alarm... who can remember who said what where?
I'll pay for the information.
Talk, or you'll end on the gallows yourself.
If you put it like that, I cannot refuse.
So that's how the new order is supposed to look like? Like Tsar's or even worse.bleh.
If you put it like that, I cannot refuse.

The officer, that's what he said he was, was one of those, that led an insurrection in Pugachov's time, you won't see him in the camp, but a bit further down is a tiny camp, that's where he ought to be.
What do you want?
Halt! They say you're the traitor, revolting against the Chef...
Good joke, I'm not asking anyone to revolt, they themselves don't want Radishchev as a leader and asked me for help... I'm doing what I'm asked for.
I think, that's enough.
I think, that's enough. At the orders of the leader of the revolution, Alexander Radishchev, I demand you surrender and submit to a trial.
You can leave.
Enough. Go away wherever you want. Do not return, ever.
Hah, nice one. I won't give up so easily, I deserve to rule as much as that usurper!

See {playername}, we've sent emissaries in the country, they were going to spread the revolutionary ideals among the common folk. But lately I found out, that one of our men operating in {s20} and the area nearby is under enemy observation, and this means, that he may be captured at any time, especially when someone contacts him.

We cannot let this happen, so go to {s20} and help him escape. He lives in the suburbs, hmmm... in a... house of fleshly pleasures, you know.... rules of a conspiracy. You should easily recognize the place.
The whole area is probably swarming with spies, so act during the night, silently and discreetly.

I have another task demanding a lot of agility and skill. {s20}, named {s21}, a tsarist desk-jockey turned out to be the worst kind of traitor. The lowlife induced many people into the conspiracy, and now plans to hand them over to the enemy, along with the insurrection plans. Infiltrate {s22} and get him, before he carries out his plan or we're doomed!

I must acknowledge with shame, not all volounteers turn out to be as dedicated to the cause as you {playername}. Recently we've had a large group of marauders leave the marching column. The blackguards have been carrying out rapes and robberies for several days, terrorizing the neighboring villages. Eventually they attacked a commissar bearing the wages for one of the regiments. Find them, execute them and try to recover the funds.
Mercy! Mercy! If you spare me, I'll tell you where we buried the money!
Take them to hell with you. Fire!
Lead the way, make haste, I might change my mind.
Here's all of our loot, can we go?
Loot, that's one thing, justice is another. Fire!
You're free to go.

There are rumors, that there is a spy sent by the enemy in the camp and he's preparing to escape and inform the enemy of our position. Hide near the camp, catch the traitor and exact justice... remember, only death is the proper punishment for betrayal.

A convoy bearing {s20} got stuck in a nearby gorge, I've sent some men already, but I'm afraid it won't be enough, find them and help them. It is crucial, to keep the convoy, until reinforcements arrive.
Hail {playername}, everything's been prepared, they should be here in a couple of hours, we just have to wait until they fall for our trap.

I've granted you freedom only for now, anytime later they might remember you and haul you from court to court... a conflict with Branicki's clientele is no laughing matter, trust me. So you cannot stay here, and coming back to your fiefs would only endanger you and your families.

So, you must leave the city today and go back to Hungary. You will find a man that heads the conspiracy there, I'll write a letter of recommendation to him, and you do what you can, gain his trust and help the conspirators' plans.
You will go, an emissary of ours, and simultaneousl a leader of volounteer company. Look around the local taverns and inns for men, get a company of twenty men and go on your way.

There are lots of various lawless gangs attacking the travellers, so keep an eye for yourself and your companions, and you will be able to slip through unnotice. Accept this gold, a good company costs good coin.
Farewell {playername}, once again thanks for everything. Godspeed!
If you're in the know, I'd like to introduce someone to you.
This is Julian Ursyn Niemcewicz, Tadeusz Kosciuszko's secretary.
Hello, I'm glad I can meet such a fine man.
I'm honored, {playername}, at your service.

Mister Niemcewicz, was sent to organize a certain mission, designed to weaken our enemy, so that we have better chances once the insurrection breaks out. Before we tell you more however, you must prove, that you're worth it. Saving me was a fine achievement, but we have to be sure, that you can be trusted.
See {playername} it might have evaded your notice, but we've been tailed since we left the tavern. They even followed us here, so it seems to me they will be nearby. Take care of them.
It is nice to welcome you, you've shown your bravery in the tavern, showing up suddenly and saving us from the danger.
I'm glad, that I've been able to save you from trouble milady... without any ulterior motives of course, as us noblemen should.
Mmm...nobleman you say? With which coat of arms were you graced?
Of course, I'm a nobleman, but...
Of course, I'm a nobleman, but I left my family rings and the rest of the signs of nobility I left in my fief before travelling.
I can offer you many things, but before that happens, you will need a material proof of your nobility. Your word is valuable to me, but among us nobility, a document is of utmost importance.
A noble person needs no coat of arms.
A noble person needs no coat of arms.
You have a point, but the nobility here is rather traditional... get a coat of arms, for me, I will reward you for that.
Greetings, I'm {playername} and I come bearing a letter from Jan Jablonski.
No time to waste, return to Krakow immediately.
It's the first time I hear of you, but it's nice to meet you.

You are reporting of things of great importance, thank you. Tell mister Jablonski, that we will be ready, I won't give you a document, the times are chaotic, I don't want it to all into the wrong hands. Fare thee well.
Have mehcy kindh sah, I'm pooh, not getting in anyone's way, don't huht me.
You're free.
You're free.
Freedom has a cost.
Freedom has a cost.
Thank you sir, I won't forget that.
Why, but of course, of course... take this as a proof of my gratitude.
My father has an exceptionally important task for you, we'll talk later.
I will now indulge your curiosity, ask about anything you want... as long as it's reasonable.
For what purpose did you go to Vienna?
May I know, why did you go to Vienna?

You may, I've been going to Vienna in the name of General Kosciuszko with a diplomatic mission. As you likely heard from the gossip or other rumors, an armed insurgency against the invader is soon to occur. Before the time of vengeance is here, we're planning to reach an agreement with the Habsburg Monarchy. A war on three fronts, that's not the kind of war anyone ever won, but on two... we're hoping we'll manage.
If you excuse my boldness, may I ask something about your daughter?
If you excuse my boldness, may I ask something about your daughter?
Taking in account what I owe you...
Has she mentioned me?
Has your daughter mentioned my person after returning to Krakow?
That's all I wanted to know.
Nothing, excuse my boldness sir.
I will await your return impatiently...
No time to waste, get moving quick.
Welcome, I'm glad to be able to be hosting you in my humble abode. Thanks again for saving my life.

Nolens volens, you've been pulled into a conflict, in which you might do a great service to the Fatherland. When we met in the tavern, I've been returning from a mission as a deputy of the Patriotic Faction. The people fighting to liberate the Commonwealth from the treacherous rule of Targowica and enemy powers' paid shills.

So far the attempts to liberate the land from Tsar's rule were as you know unsuccessful. But this time we're wiser for the experience and planning an insurrection. Even more, a popular levy of all the estates.
Feel free to ask questions, I owe you an explanation, and there's many things you ought to know too...
Tell me more about the conspirators' plans.
So I will, since I took part in formulating it myself.

As you might have guessed, we're preparing an insurrection in the Commonwealth. I can't divulge too many details, especially not right now, but I will tell you what's necessary. To guarantee the success of future actions we need to look support by any means available, both within, Not to search too far on Hungary a conspiracy against the Habsburg rule is being organized. It should weaken the forces of our common enemies greatly and with some luck lead to both us and our allies regaining our freedom.
That is certainly not a small risk, you could even say the plan is insane, but in it lies the hope for Commonwealth to regain its freedom.
Tell me more about the causes of the current situation.

Well, {playername}, we ourselves are to blame, too many years without reforms, corruption amongst magnates, greed and sloth, all of those, causes of our fall. Not that the noble freedom was not the thorn in neighboring powers' sides for a long time. It all began with king Sobieski's death.after his death all the feuds and strife took off, not reforms.

With each year the influence of Russian Empire rose, it was the time of internal strife, poor rule of the Saxons, then king Stanislaw. In 1768 the nobility confederated against the king and the increasing influence of the Russian Empire. As you might guess, four years of internal fighting weakened the country greatly.

Finally in 1772, I remember like it was yesterday, I was young then... in aforesaid year 1772, the Empress along with the King of Prussia and Emperor Francis II signed a pact of partition, with the Sejm's allowing it. I then left the country to study in Padua, so I didn't know what happened, but when I returned it was even worse. The last attempt to change our situation was an attempt to introduce a Constitution, but the initial success ended with the Targowica Confederacy and the war with Russia.

I fought with Kosciuszko in Dubienka, what a battle! We fought them off marvellously! But for naught. The king joined the Confederates, and the Sejm once again under the duress of an army carried out a partition.
And today, this is our last chance... but well, that's pretty much all there is to know, and you probably know it already.
Tell me why were you delegated to Vienna.
Our mission was to negotiate the Austrian neutrality towards the insurrection. The results of the mission will however be uncertain until the end, we didn't receive any guarantees.
So I know everything I need.
If you know all you need, then before we can talk about the future, there's something that needs to be done. We suspect, that the thugs you beat up, is not everyone that has been following us,

I've seen three suspicious-looking people pottering around nearby, similar to the ones seen earlier in the tavern. Whether they fled somewhere, or hid I don't know, but we need to make sure, that they are not a threat. I hope, that you and Grzegorz, who you probably met already, can take care of that.
Welcome, I'm glad to be able to be hosting you in my humble abode.
I ought to do some explaining, after all, now we're on the same side. You'd better not go to your fiefs now, the news travel fast in the Commonwealth, Tsar's men will know where to look for.

But nevermind them... I'm glad to see you back. Mister Jablonowski would want to see you too most likely. It's thanks to my cousin we've been released so quickly. Go to him without further delay, he and mister Niemcewicz have something important to tell you... I meanwhile will go , I have something to take care of.
Go, waste no time, you didn't forget where Jablonowskis' townhouse is, have you?

Well, well... disrupting peace, murder, all of that right in the middle of day right under the town hall. If it wasn't enough, that you're all cutting each other up in your forays, ugh... you'll pay for it all.
To the dungeon with them!

Listen well. Allegedly misters Jablonowski and Niemcewicz seen in the vicinity of the market the people who stayed in the tavern with us. It wouldn't be anything extraordinary, but one of them is known to Jablonowki, he's a supporter of the Targowica. Let's find them before it's too late... they must be nearby.

Really? Hmm... who would have thought! The traitors are growing bold, but we'll chase them out! Like my grandfather's grandfather, chasing off the Swedes, and you should know, that it was Anno Domini 1659, one and a half centuries ago now, and the memory of the ancestor is still alive and well. Roch was his name, God bless his soul...
It's a good and respectable thing, keeping the memory of the ancestors. But let's go looking for the scoundrels, they may flee.
Ah, right, right. Let's go.
I have no plans regarding you miss.
I have no plans regarding you miss.
So you were thinking, that I'm of that sort, that I'm gonna believe you? You're so wrong. But that aside, what are we to do? I'm guessing, that there's a reason you came...
Let's not get in each other's way.
Let's not get n each other's way. Alright?
Fine, I hope, that you'll leave as quickly as you arrived. But let's leave that aside, what are we to do? I'm guessing, that there's a reason you came...
We need to check if we have been tailed, allegedly mister Potocki saw two men both here and at the tavern...I don't know if that's a coincidence or not, but they must be nearby...
Yeeeees, I think I know where to look... I can smell sneaks and collaborators from two miles away.z wiatrem i pod wiatr. Chodźmy.
Before you launch, may I know who the hell you are and what you looking for?
And who are you to ask the Watch or the Army?
You've accompanied us in our travels.
I don't recall ever drinking with you... and anyway, we come from here and we're not going anywhere.
You'd better answer fast. [Threat],
Look at that golden tongue, gentlemen.
Go put your head in the well, maybe that will make you feel better. We have as much right to stand here as you do.
If you won't go on your own freewill...
Well, if you don't want to handle it the easy way...
No, nevermind, we'll go now.
I suggest you start talking or we'll make you talk.
Welcome sir. I've been informed of your arrival, His Lordship is waiting.
How may I serve you?

{playername}?! My God, I'm so glad to see you! Mister Jablonowski told me, how you served him from his troubles. Hm, you probably don't know who the hell I am? Right, right, I should have introduced myself.
Still here? I recommend you leave promptly...

Grzegorz Jablonowski sum, like my late father, God bless his soul! He was the uncle of my cousin, whom you have so deftly saved. Between you and me, you're likely a good fencer, huh? I know a fai bit in that matter as well. We should duel... but not here and now, but later? Agreed?
I knew I could find a brother in you, ever since I've seen you, I swear to God! The one I had by birth was mauled by wolves when we were hunting partridges near Kalisz. God have mercy on his soul!
Perhaps, who's speaking?
Perhaps, but it's none of your business, tell me your name first.
Eh, excuse me?ranting like that, they are waiting inside and probably worried already. Enter without worry.I'll wait here.
I'm Albert Tukaj, Slepowron my coat of arms. Don't get mad unnecessarily... I heard what you achieved, saving the miss and the sir from Tsar's agents... pity I wasn't there,
No use deliberating.
But I was there and it's my accomplishment, no point in your deliberation.
If that is so, then go, but you will regret your arrogance. And remember, keep your hands away from the miss, I better not see you nearby her.
It's better, that you haven't been there.
Pity? It's a good thing you weren't there, we managed to avoid casualties.
What did you say? How dare you, go away or I cannot be responsible for my actions from now on...
The pleasure is mine, visit me as often as you can.
Bastard, how could you do this to me? I hate you, go away.
Here we are {playername}, you probably haven't been to Krakow for a long time?
Thought so, have a walk around the town, take care of whatever you have to do, then please come over to the corner townhouse right next to the Market, I will be waiting for you there.
'ullo good man, ye be goin' to the tavern?
Exactly so, why?
Exactly so, why?
Perhaps, but that's none of your business.
Perhaps, but that's none of your business.
I seen tha' right now in the tavern, sum kinna lord and his servants be staying. What they 'gon be doin', that I'unno, but sum kinna bad thing is a'brewing.
Do you know anything more?
Thanks for the advice, farewell.
I'll take care, take a coin in thanks.
I will watch out, have a coin, a good advice or warning is worth that.
Do you know anything more?
They took th' peasants and done thrown them outta the tavern... a Russian is leading them, that I heard of th' way he was speaking.
Thanks for the advice, farewell.
Thanks for the advice, farewell.
I'll take care, take a coin in thanks.
Ah, charitable sir, God bless you!
Leave.
Who are you and where do you come from? Aren't you a companion of these scoundrels?
I'm {playername}, a nobleman from the Crown. I'm returning to the Commonwealth from Hungary after a long absence. I was planning to stay a while in the tavern, then I heard the screams.
May you no longer worry about these people, they lay defeated. And you are free.

Thank God! Thank you, sir, for saving us from our trouble, we've been already thinking we're going to get moved to God knows where... I'm Stanislaw Jablonowski, the son of Antoni, the Castellan of Krakow.
As I presume, none of them were left alive? I'd be glad to ask them a couple questions otherwise, maybe they know a bit more...

Julian Ursyn Niemcewicz and from this day onwards your debtor. It was no accident they wanted to kidnap us. I overheard them talking, saying they were hired by the Targowica Confederates. Who else would dare to attack emissaries?
As I said, you may find the corpses in the courtyard.
The leader of those blackguards is alive. Do to him whatever you wish.
I gave my word that I will let the leader go. Even the word given to the enemy should be respected.

Oh well, the important thing is, we're still alive, thanks to you. And now let's not waste any time, let's go to Krakow, before we run into some patrol. You'll go with us {playername}, if you beat up regular thugs, you might get away with it, but for Targowica's servants you would doubtlessly end up in the tower. And in our company you will remain safe... and without doubt do a service to the Fatherland.
Well, dlga_glistrozmowa1:glistrozmowa2
column3: Who are you to question , even given to thugs and traitors. As a nobleman I understand, especially, since I owe you my life. And now let's not waste any time anymore, let's go to Krakow, before we run into some patrol. You'll go with us {playername}, if you beat up regular thugs, you might get away with it, but for Targowica's servants you would get at least ten years of prison. And in our company you will remain safe... and without doubt do a service to the Fatherland.

error,: Excellent, as soon as we get to Krakow he'll go to the dungeon for interrogation. We'll learn everything he knows. Onwards to Krakow, before we run into some patrol. You'll go with us {playername},
Right, let's go.
May I know why gentlemen you are travelling?
As I mentioned, we've been emissaries to Vienna, to the court of Emperor Francis. But that's not the right time for further explanations.
One more thing, what happened to the leader of those bandits?
You see, he's an agent, a Russian spy. Of that, I have no doubt.

He had been sent to kidnap me!Apologies. I haven't introduced myself. My name is Jan Alojzy Jablonowski. Pleasure to meet you.travelling with my daughter from Vienna... I was in a confidential diplomatic mission.
I can trust you, As of now , you too are an enemy of the Empire and Targowica. {s0},
I cannot, I need him
He's yours.
Good, let's go.
For what purpose did you go to Vienna?
I cannot, I need him.
If that's so, he's yours.
Excellent, a wise choice, thank you once again.
If that's so, it's your choice, watch him.He knows too much...
Good, let's go.
For what purpose did you go to Vienna?
We'll be on our way.
For what purpose did you go to Vienna?
You will learn soon, now let's go, the sooner we vanish, the better.
Pax, pax! We can sort this out, right? After all it's just a neighborly dispute, nothing more...
No-one insults me without severe consequences! ,
No-one insults me without severe consequences!
What do you want? Can't you see the tavern is closed?
Who the hell you are to order me around?
If you won't go willingly, we'll teach you a lesson...you've heard too much anyway.
The patrol was successful Sir. {s0} is being guarded by {reg0} men. The size of the garrison is:^ {s1},
At your service, what do you wish?
Propose a leave.
What would you say about getting a leave?
Of course, if I'm needed again, you know where to find me.
Carry out a patrol.
Nothing, goodbye.
Where shall I scout?
Nowhere.
Greetings good sir, wouldn't you need in your troop a man for special tasks? That would be espionage and all kinds of diversions, especially for taking fortresses.
I report with regret, the mission was a failure.
The gate was blown up as ordered.
How much do I need? 1000 zlotys of front payment, then 200 weekly... not cheap, but I can be very useful to you, you'll see yourself.
That's the man I need, you're hired.
Excellent, I'll be ready to go soon.
I would, but I'm short on money.
Pity, when you get some you know where to look for me.
Maybe another time, goodbye.
Your will, if I'm needed, you know where to look for me.
{s20}, I'm {playername}.
{s20}, I'm {playername}.
Why not, gladly.
Not now, I have to go.
Ugly thing, when from a sheathe of silver a sword of lead is drawn, and a coward to boot, no trace of nobleman's honor in sight.
Enough for now, come another time.
Dishonorable do throw your weapon away during combat like that, goodbye.
Hah, I thought, that I'm fighting a honorable nobleman, but now I can see, you're not worthy to duel me.
Congratulations, you are a fine marksman, here's the prize.
Enough for a week of hard drinking, duelling you {playername} is a real pleasure.
Hit the bullseye in the sky, seriously now... maybe you'll be luckier next time.
Greetings, my name is {playername}.
Not the first time I heard on faires, brothels and taverns of your deeds, I'd gladly try your skill at sabre against mine.
{playername}? First time I hear of you...
I recall your name, wonder if you're as good a soldier as the people say you are.
Let us fight then.
I have to go, farewell.
Excellent, take a pick, pistols or rapiers?
Pistols.
Rapiers.
Agreed, before we start, do we duel to the first blood?
I won't risk my life, first blood it is.
Ah hell, glory or death!
You're a brave one, you might regret that yet.
What's your bet?
Sadly, I'm broke.
I'll double that. May the best one win.
Let's go.
Let's be on our way.

Hullo, wouldn't you be lookin' for some men in your comp'ny? Me and my brothers, we're looking for some honest work, to get food in our bellies and some coin in our purses. Wouldn't you happ'n to have something like that?
Luck is on your side, how many zlotys you want for the service?
Enough to cover the expenses, that being booze, girls and equipment...
800 zlotys should do the trick. We'd be ready to go today.
Deal, here's the cash, I'm hoping you're worth it.
We'll do our best to convince our benefactor of that.
I'll take {reg5} of you.
You wanna split up companions? My heart is heavy, but you're gonna have to add 300 zlotys on top of that, otherwise - get out!
Deal, here's your money.
I don't have that much, I'll get going now.
I wouldn't be able to afford my other needs, maybe another time, goodbye.
I'm not looking for trouble, goodbye.
Let's go.
Let's be on our way.
Hello sir, how may I serve you?
I'm looking for men, as an escort and for defense, don't you know anyone right for the job?

You're in the right place, me and my comrades, we've seen several wars, you'd be hard-pressed to find finer soldiers. For 700 zlotys we may join your company.jeno pamiętaj, że honor cenniejszy dla nas niż życie.
I'm glad to welcome you in my troop, here's the money.
We'll do our best to convince our benefactor of that.
I can only hire {reg5} of you.
So be it, but we all have to have a livelihood... you see, 800 zlotys and not a coin below that.
I'm glad to welcome you in my troop.
Too expensive, goodbye.
I can't afford you, farewell.
Nothing, I have to go.
Let's go.
-Leave-,
Hail, good sir, I'm {playername}. Aren't you perhaps looking to join a decent company?
Hello, you're a godsend sir, I and my friends were looking out for someone willing to provide for us in exchange for our sabres, food and a handful of coins.
Excellent, may I know with whom am I talking?
I cannot hire you now.
I'm {s0} coat of arms {s1} with {reg0} companions we're coming from the {s2} lands. We don't need much, each of us for 80 zlotys will loyally support you in any cause.
Hm, I can hire {reg6} of you.
I'm glad, welcome to my company.
Costly, I can't afford it. Farewell.
Your will, but know, that there's no shortage of scum in taverns and on the roads.
Why are you asking, eh?
Deal, in this case it will be {reg5}.
I'm glad, welcome to my company.
Expensive, drop it by 50, we'll have a deal.
Costly. I can't afford it. Farewell.
We may be poor, but we have our honor. For that much you can hire some serfs, not blood and bone Sarmatians.
Today we live, tomorrow we rot, so be it.
I've heard of you. Dishonourable things. My honor is more precious than the gold in my purse.my honor is more precious than gold.
Recant it right now, or we're gonna fight. Nobody stains my honor with impunity!
I'm partial to the thesis that everyone has their price. What would you say for a round thousand zlotys?
Leave.
Honor is one thing, stomach another...
Tis unworthy of a nobleman. Leave quick or I'll slap you with the flat of my sabre like I would any other churl.
The noble brothers here witnessed it. You started the fight, not us.
Let's go.

Good day to you sir, wouldn't you be looking for some people to work or defend you? I and my companions, we've been looking for an honest job, a bunch of tough lads, we'll be of good service for you. Just think, the roads are dangerous, we'll serve for just food and a small wage.
How much do you want?
And who would you be?
You don't seem trustworthy, outta way.
Just enough to pay for the bullets, wenches and booze before we can go, 100 for each of the {reg0} of us, no less, but you're wealthy, so it's not much for you.
None of your business, either we have a deal or you can be on your way. So what will it be?
Alright then, how much?
I'm not dealing with the likes of you... goodbye.
For that much I could be dead drunk all the way to Saint Jack's, come on now.
You're not cheap, but you will be of use, here's the money.
{reg6} and not a penny more.
Generous, we'll repay the favor well, we can set out even just now.
Khy, we could live a while without booze, deal.
Wenches and booze are must-haves, can't have one without the other.
As you wish. Be vigilant.
There's enough room in the troop for the {reg4} of you.
Hold up, I and my friends are one company...
So you'll pay, just 100 more, so they won't be starving.
Deal, here's your cash.
Fools, I should pay for men I'm not taking?
Hello my friend! I can see, that you're quite a soldier! Wouldn't you want to gain the glory of joining the finest regiment of the undefeatable army of the Commonwealth?
And who are you?
Leave.

A veteran of numerous battles and duels, on the fields of battle and love, heheh... if you know what I mean. Today, now that my youth is gone, Jesli pragniesz pojsc w moje slady I'm sitting in this tavern and enjoying the drinks, ladies, and other well-deserved fruits of glory. If you want to follow my path, and you will if you know what's good for you, I can help you, as our Marshall has entrusted me with the respectable function of a recruiter.
And what kind of benefits I can expect from joining your army?
That's what I wanted my entire life! Wenches, drinks, glory! Where do I sign?
Army? That's not for me... I hate being degraded and being ordered around.

Aha! A pragmatic man, that's what we need. I can see myself in you, when I was your age of course. The same shine in your eye! So I'm going to do you a favor and get you an officer's patent, thanks to which you'll be able to enter the high society. You'll also get a wage befitting your competences and an assignment of fresh recruits. And remember, that war is a very profitable business for our kind of people.

Aha! An ambitious man, that's what we need. I can see myself in you, when I was your age of course. The same shine in your eye! So I'm going to do you a favor and get you an officer's patent, thanks to which you'll be able to enter the high society. You'll also get a wage befitting your competences and an assignment of fresh recruits. And remember, that war is a very profitable business for our kind of people.

Aha! A temperamental man, that's what we need. I can see myself in you, when I was your age of course. The same shine in your eye! So I'm going to do you a favor and get you an officer's patent, thanks to which you'll be able to enter the high society. You'll also get a wage befitting your competences and an assignment of fresh recruits. And remember, that war is a very profitable business for our kind of people.
You convinced me. I will sign the contract.
I think I'm gonna resign.

In this case know, that upon signing you're joining the army of the Commonwealth and promise to protect her borders, fight her enemies and multiply the glory of her leader {s0}. You will carry out the Marshall's orders and will avoid rogue actions against the regulations. Your current company will be dissolved and dismissed.except for subordinates and companions, who agree to join the army with you. In exchange you will report to me to receive one of the regiments available for you. The service ends when you die only, chyba ze Dowodztwo zadecyduje inaczej. unless Command decides otherwise.
Pity, great pity, if you change your mind, you know where to look for me.
Done! From now on you might report for troops to me or one of my colleagues.
Greetings to a man of enterprise! To what do I owe the pleasure? Business? Pleasure? Perhaps, finally, a manly decision to join the glorious ranks?
How exactly would I benefit from joining this army of Yours?
Leave without a word.
Hail, captain.
I always claimed that there's a great career fated for us pragmatic men. Pick your new regiment.
I always claimed that there's a great career fated for us ambitious men. Pick your new regiment.
I always claimed that there's a great career fated for clever men like us. Pick your new regiment.
Greetings. I'm captain {playername}, I received a letter with an order to come here in order to receive a promotion.

Well met, I heard much of your services; you fought bravely for noble freedom on many a battlefield, not once forcing the enemy into a rout. I see a fine commander and soldier in you, we need just the kind of men.

I am therefore mighty glad to have the honor of bestowing upon you the rank of a Major in the service of the Commonwealth of Both Nations. Cease not in a fight for her glory with your experience and martial skill.
I am honored, I shall not falter in acting towards once and for all forcing the enemy and the traitors out of the borders of our country.

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_event_triggered:infiltracja_prawie_koniec_ale_jeszcze_nie_1|Stop! Oh fuck! I give up! I’ll tell you everything! All I know! But I beg you, don’t kill me., "

dlga_infiltracja_prawie_koniec_ale_jeszcze_nie_1:infiltracja_prawie_koniec_ale_jeszcze_nie|No doubt. Traitors usually talk a lot.
dlga_infiltracja_prawie_koniec_ale_jeszcze_nie:infiltracja_prawie_koniec|Before I will abandon my sinful life. I've got my last will. Let’s catch that scumbag who betrayed his fellows and hang him. I must know that he will be punished.

error,: Enough! That man expiated his sins, there is no need to look for him. You'd better think about yourself, if you want to survive""
Treachery, my fellows! Kill them all!", "
That men, accosted me in a inn and claimed to be my fellow, wasn’t he?", "

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_infiltracja_kryjowka:infiltracja_kryjowka_1|I can’t remember his face… Can you help me?

error,: Am I to help you remember myself? Do you remember those times when we drunk and ordered one streetwalker, because we wanted to economize? What kind of a friend you are? Only purpose to forgive you is the time. How much time passed? It was about 20 years…",
Story 2,

dlga_start:dialognotused: dlga_infiltracja_kryjowka_r2:infiltracja_kryjowka_f|Do you remember St. Mark’s Day, it was a market in Tykocin? It was the place where we met., "

error,: On a first Sunday after All Souls, it will be about 3 years now. We drunk in Chalice Inn… surely you remember a place and old Pavic, don’ t you?", "
It was the Rome Inn where we met 10 years ago. It was my cousin’s wedding, I think… Or it might have been someones else's… Who cares?"

dlga_start:dialognotused:
dlga_infiltracja_kryjowka_3:infiltracja_kryjowka_4|Well, maybe that's true. What do you want?"
,
dlga_infiltracja_kryjowka_4:infiltracja_kryjowka_5|So… For some time I have had some problems with my neighbour. Can I be in your company? I can prove myself useful., "

error,: erm… So I have to consult with my companions… And you… Go to the town and bring some hooch, but be careful, those bastards are mixing it with water."

dlga_start:dialognotused:
dlga_infiltracja_kryjowka_f:infiltracja_kryjowka_ff|On St. Mark’s? Hmm… I was imprisoned in Krakow then. You are lying my little friend, you are only a little lying slime. Only because of our relationship…. You will be punished my friend."
, "

dlga_infiltracja_kryjowka_ff:close_window|Tie a stone to his neck and throw him in the river, he's seen too much.
dlga_start:close_window.55|Still here? Get going or you'll miss them.
dlga_start:close_window.56|We're close, follow me.
dlga_start:infiltracja_1_main|What can I do for you?
dlga_start:infiltracja_1_main.1|Ha, you've got some strong arms. Ask for whatever you want, I know you're a good man.
dlga_start:close_window.57|Enough with the spectacle, if you want to be beat up again, feel free to come by.
dlga_start:infiltracja_3_plac|So? Shall we make a deal?
dlga_start:close_window.58|To arms, sir, before the nightfall if you don't mind.
dlga_start:close_window.59|Mister Officer, eh? Greetings...
dlga_start:infiltracja|G'day, what is up? Shall we have a drink?
dlga_start:infiltracja_walka|G'day, what is up? Shall we have a drink?
dlga_infiltracja:infiltracja_1|And who are you to ask? Do I know you?
dlga_infiltracja_1:infiltracja_1_1|You should.
dlga_infiltracja_1_1:infiltracja_2|Me?! You don't know me? Barnaba of Konikow! If it wasn't for me having a damn good day, I'd have you beat, tied to a saddle and sent off to Transylvania.
dlga_infiltracja_2:infiltracja_3|You can talk fast, wonder if you can take swings just quarter as quickly, eh?
dlga_infiltracja_3:close_window|Let's find out.
dlga_infiltracja_walka:infiltracja_walka_2|So, shall we test each other?
dlga_infiltracja_walka_2:close_window|Let's go.
dlga_infiltracja_walka_2:close_window.1|Eh, not now.
dlga_infiltracja_3:close_window.1|Eh, farewell.
dlga_infiltracja_2:infiltracja_1_main|Right, you do look like a damn strong man, pardon me. What can I do for you?
dlga_infiltracja_1_main:infiltracja_7|Lead me to your comrades, I'd like to talk to them.[Persuasion]
dlga_infiltracja_7:infiltracja_7a|Oh? Do you know what you're requesting?
dlga_infiltracja_7a:infiltracja_7ap|Go, I'm a friend of your boss's.
dlga_infiltracja_7ap:close_window|Guess you might be right, the mug's sorta similar... who knows, who knows... saddle up, let's go.
dlga_infiltracja_7ap:infiltracja_1_main|Ha, that's a good one! You're lying, swear to God! Our leader is a man of great many talents and just as much wisdom, he doesn't make friends with the likes of you.
dlga_infiltracja_1_main:infiltracja_3a|Just one thing I need to know, where are your comrades?[Bribe]
dlga_infiltracja_3a:infiltracja_3_plac|Heh, you think you can just go and ask for such a thing? I am a simple man, but I know what I know, the likes of you have your sacks filled with money, eh? And in that case, why don't we ease your burden a bit? Let's say, no more and no less than four round thousands, eh? Take it or leave it, sir... captain?
dlga_infiltracja_3_plac:infiltracja_3_plac1|Deal. Here's the money.
dlga_infiltracja_3_plac1:close_window|The hideout is in the forest nearby. You ought to find it without much trouble... and now leave me alone, I have to make my preparations for a journey. Long journey.
dlga_infiltracja_3_plac:infiltracja_3_plac2|I'm a bit short on cash at the moment.
dlga_infiltracja_3_plac2:close_window|Money? What monet? I remember nothing...
dlga_infiltracja_1_main:close_window|Nevermind, farewell.
dlga_infiltracja_1:close_window|Perhaps a mistake indeed, farewell.
dlga_start:ramun_introduce_1|Good day to you, {young man/lassie}.
dlga_ramun_introduce_1:ramun_introduce_2|Forgive me, you look like a trader, but I see none of your merchandise.
dlga_ramun_introduce_1:close_window|Never mind.
dlga_ramun_introduce_2:ramun_introduce_3|A trader? Oh, aye, I certainly am that. My merchandise is a bit different from most, however. It has to be fed and watered twice a day and tries to run away if I turn my back.
dlga_ramun_introduce_3:ramun_introduce_4|Livestock?
dlga_ramun_introduce_4:ramun_introduce_5|Close enough. I like to call myself the man who keeps every boat on this ocean moving. Boats are driven by oars, you see, and oars need men to pull them or they stop. That's where I come in.
dlga_ramun_introduce_5:ramun_introduce_6|Galley slaves.
dlga_ramun_introduce_6:ramun_introduce_7|Now you're catching on! A trading port like this couldn't survive without them. The ships lose a few hands on every voyage, so there's always a high demand. The captains come to me and they pay well.
dlga_ramun_introduce_7:ramun_introduce_8|Where do the slaves come from?
dlga_ramun_introduce_8:ramun_introduce_9|Mostly I deal in convicted criminals bought from the authorities. Others are prisoners of war from various nations, brought to me because I offer the best prices. However, on occasion I'll buy from privateers and other . . . 'individuals'. You can't be picky about your suppliers in this line of work. You wouldn't happen to have any prisoners with you, would you?
dlga_ramun_introduce_9:ramun_introduce_10|Me?
dlga_ramun_introduce_10:ramun_introduce_11|Why not? If you intend to set foot outside this town, you're going to cross swords with someone sooner or later. And, God willing, you'll come out on top. Why not make some extra money off the whole thing? Take them alive, bring them back to me, and I'll pay you fifty denars for each head. Don't much care who they are or where they come from.
dlga_ramun_introduce_11:ramun_introduce_12|Hmm. I'll think about it.
dlga_ramun_introduce_12:close_window|Do think about it! There's a lot of silver to be made, no mistake. More than enough for the both of us.
dlga_start:ramun_talk|Hello, {playername}.
dlga_ramun_pre_talk:ramun_talk|Anything else?
dlga_ramun_talk:ramun_sell_prisoners|I've brought you some prisoners, Ramun. Would you like a look?
dlga_ramun_sell_prisoners:ramun_sell_prisoners_2|Let me see what you have...
dlga_ramun_sell_prisoners_2:close_window|A pleasure doing business with you.
dlga_ramun_talk:ramun_ask_about_capturing|How do I take somebody as prisoner?
dlga_ramun_talk:ramun_ask_about_capturing.1|Can you tell me again about capturing prisoners?
dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing:ramun_have_blunt_weapon|You're new to this, aren't you? Let me explain it in simple terms. The basic rule of taking someone prisoner is knocking him down with a blunt weapon, like a mace or a club, rather than cutting him open with a sword. That way he goes to sleep for a little while rather than bleeding to death, you see? I'm assuming you have a blunt weapon with you . . .
dlga_ramun_have_blunt_weapon:ramun_have_blunt_weapon_yes|Of course.
dlga_ramun_have_blunt_weapon:ramun_have_blunt_weapon_no|As a matter of fact, I don't.
dlga_ramun_have_blunt_weapon_yes:ramun_ask_about_capturing_2|Good. Then all you need to do is beat the bugger down with your weapon, and when the fighting's over you clap him in irons. It's a bit different for nobles and such, they tend to be protected enough that it won't matter what kind of weapon you use, but your average rabble-rouser will bleed like a stuck pig if you get him with something sharp. I don't have many requirements in my merchandise, but I do insist they be breathing when I buy them.
dlga_ramun_have_blunt_weapon_no:ramun_have_blunt_weapon_no_2|No? Heh, well, this must be your lucky day. I've got an old club lying around that I was going to throw away. It a bit battered, but still good enough bash someone until he stops moving. Here, have it.
dlga_ramun_have_blunt_weapon_no_2:ramun_have_blunt_weapon_yes|Thanks, Ramun. Perhaps I may try my hand at it.
dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing:ramun_ask_about_capturing_2|Alright, I'll try and expain it again in simple terms. The basic rule of taking someone prisoner is knocking him down with a blunt weapon, like a mace or a club, rather than cutting him open with a sword. That way he goes to sleep for a little while rather than bleeding to death, you see? It's a bit different for nobles and such, they tend to be protected enough that it won't matter what kind of weapon you use, but your average rabble-rouser will bleed like a stuck pig if you get him with something sharp, 
dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing_2:ramun_ask_about_capturing_3|Alright, I think I understand. Anything else?
dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing_3:ramun_ask_about_capturing_4|Well, it's not as simple as all that. Blunt weapons don't do as much damage as sharp ones, so they won't bring your enemies down as quickly. And trust me, given the chance, most of the scum you run across would just as soon kill you as look at you, so don't expect any courtesy when you pull out a club instead of a sword. Moreover, having to drag prisoners to and fro will slow down your party, which is why some people simply set their prisoners free after the fighting's done. It's madness. How could anyone turn down all that silver, eh?
dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing_4:ramun_ask_about_capturing_5|Is that everything?
dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing_5:ramun_ask_about_capturing_7|Just one final thing. Managing prisoners safely is not an easy thing to do, you could call it a skill in itself. If you want to capture a lot of prisoners, you should try and learn the tricks of it yourself, or you won't be able to hang on to a single man you catch.
dlga_ramun_ask_about_capturing_7:ramun_pre_talk|Thanks, I'll keep it in mind.
dlga_ramun_talk:ramun_leave|I'd better be going.
dlga_ramun_leave:close_window|Remember, any prisoners you've got, bring them to me. I'll pay you good silver for every one.
dlga_start:close_window.60|I humbly request that your lordship keeps his hands where I can see them.
dlga_start:close_window.61|More people will join us soon, I assure you.
dlga_start:close_window.62|We'll arm the people here. You will see new troops soon.
dlga_start:close_window.63|{s20}, 
dlga_start:atakujpatrol|{s20}, 
dlga_atakujpatrol:atakujpatrol2|Surrender or die!
dlga_atakujpatrol:close_window|Nothing, goodbye.

dlga_merchant_quest_4_start:close_window|It's time, lads! Up and at them!
dlga_start:relative_saved_1a|Thank you! Thank you, {sir/my lady}, for rescuing me from those fiends. Did my brother in {s9} put you onto their track?
dlga_relative_saved_1a:close_window|Yes. I told him that I would find you. I advise you to return to your family as quickly as you can -- and be careful on the road.
dlga_start:bandit_leader_1a|Ay! Spare me! Spare my life! Let me go, and I'll go far away from here, and learn an honest trade, and you'll never hear of me again!
dlga_bandit_leader_1a:bandit_leader_1b|I'll spare your life -- but in exchange, I want information. Either you or your mates kidnapped the brother of a prominent merchant in town. Tell me where you're hiding him, and give me your word that you'll stop troubling the people of these parts, and you can go free.
dlga_start:looter_leader_1|What do you want?
dlga_looter_leader_1:looter_leader_2|I've been looking for you. Tell me where you keep your prisoners, and I'll let you go.
dlga_looter_leader_1:close_window|Nothing. We'll leave you in peace.
dlga_looter_leader_2:looter_leader_3|Hah! Those prisoners are only going free if you pay their ransom. Did you bring any silver?
dlga_looter_leader_3:close_window|No, but I brought steel.
dlga_bandit_leader_1b:close_window|Oh bless you, {sir/my lady}. Bless you. We've done the lad no harm. We've been keeping him in our hideout near {s9}. I'll describe the area nearby in detail, so there's no mistaking it...
dlga_start:rescue_prisoner_succeed_2|{playername}, you saved him! Thank you ever so much for rescuing my {s11}. Please, take this as some small repayment for your noble deed.
dlga_rescue_prisoner_succeed_2:lord_pretalk|Always an honour to serve, {s65}.
dlga_start_up_quest_1_next:close_window|Are you all right? Well.... I guess you're alive, at any rate. I'm not sure that we can say the same for the other fellow. That's one less thief to trouble our streets at night, although Heaven knows he won't be the last.... Anyway, maybe you can help me with something. Let's talk more inside. Out here, we don't know who's listening, 
dlga_start:merchant_quest_2a|Splendid work. You have hired enough men to take on the bandits. Now -- travellers entering {s9} have told us that there is a small group of robbers lurking on the outside of town. I suspect that they are all from the same band, the one that took my brother. Hunt them down and defeat them, and make them disclose the location of their lair!
dlga_start:merchant_quest_3a|So, you've found out where they hid my brother? Splendid work. I flatter myself that I'm a fine judge of character, and you look to be a {man/woman} who can get things done. Now, go out and save his unworthy hide!
dlga_start:merchant_quest_3b|Well... My brother is home safe. I'm not sure what to do with him -- maybe pack him off to a university outside Calradia. That way, if he gets knocked on the head in a street brawl, no one can say it's my fault. But that's not your problem. Here's the rest of your reward. It was well-earned.
dlga_merchant_quest_3b:merchant_quest_4a|The money is most welcome, and I am glad to have been of service
dlga_merchant_quest_4a:merchant_quest_4b|Good! Now... Are you interested in making some more?
dlga_merchant_quest_4b:merchant_quest_4b1|Possibly. What do you need?
dlga_merchant_quest_4b1:merchant_quest_4b2|Remember how I told you that the bandits had an ally inside the walls? I think I know who it is -- the captain of the watch, no less. Some months ago this captain, seeing the amount of profit we merchants were making from trade across the frontiers, decided to borrow some money to sponsor a caravan. Unfortunately, like many who are new to commerce, he failed to realize that great profit only comes with great risk. So he sank all his money into the most expensive commodities, and of course his caravan was captured and looted, and he lost everything.
dlga_merchant_quest_4b2:merchant_quest_4b3|As a consequence, it seems, our captain turned to villainy to recoup his fortune. I supposed I'd do the same if, the Heavens forbid, I ever faced indebtedness and ruination. Now, any watch captain worth his salary will have a few thieves and robbers on his payroll, to inform on the rest, but our captain decides to employ these bastards wholesale. He brings them into the town, lets them do as they will, and takes a share of their take. You've heard of poachers turning gamekeepers? Well, in the unfortunate land of Calradia, sometimes gamekeepers will turn poacher. Luckily, there's are still a few brave, honest souls in the watch who've told me how he works.
dlga_merchant_quest_4b3:merchant_quest_4b4|Now -- here's my plan. I could bring this to the attention of {s4}, lord of the city, but that would mean an inquiry, my word against the captain's, and witnesses can be bought and evidence destroyed, or maybe the whole thing will be forgotten if the enemy comes across the border again, and all I'll get for my trouble is a knife in the ribs. In time of war, you see, a king's eye wanders far from his domain, and his subjects suffer. So I've got another idea. I've got a small group of townsfolk together, some men in my employ and some others who've lost relatives to these bandits, and we'll storm the captain's home and bring him in chains before {s4}, hopefully with a few captured bandits to explain how things stack up, 
dlga_merchant_quest_4b4:merchant_quest_4b5|All I need now is someone to lead my little army into battle -- and I can't think of anyone better than you. So, what do you say?
dlga_merchant_quest_4b5:merchant_quest_4b6|How do I know that you're telling me the truth?
dlga_merchant_quest_4b6:merchant_quest_4b7|Oh, well, I suppose it's possible that I found a dozen bandits who were willing to give their lives to give a passing stranger a false impression of life in old {s4}... Well, I guess you can't really know if my word is good, but I reckon you've learned by now that my money is good, and there's another 100 denars, or maybe a bit more, that's waiting for you if you'll do me this last little favor. So what do you say?
dlga_merchant_quest_4b7:merchant_quest_4b8|All right. I'll lead your men.
dlga_merchant_quest_4b7:merchant_quest_4_decline|I'm sorry. This is too much, too fast. I need time to think.
dlga_merchant_quest_4b8:merchant_quest_4b9|Splendid. It's been a long time since I staked so much on a single throw of the dice, and frankly I find it exhilarating. My men are ready to move on your word. Are you ready?
dlga_merchant_quest_4b9:merchant_quest_4_accept|Yes. Give them the sign.
dlga_merchant_quest_4b9:merchant_quest_4_decline|Not now. I will need to rest before I can fight again.
dlga_merchant_quest_4_accept:close_window|Good! Now -- strike hard, strike fast, and the captain and his henchmen won't know what hit them. May the heavens be with you!
dlga_merchant_quest_4_decline:close_window|Right. I can keep my men standing by. If you let this go too long, then I suppose that I shall have to finish this affair without you, but I would be most pleased if you could be part of it as well. For now, take what time you need.
dlga_merchant_quest_2a:close_window|Very well. I shall hunt for bandits.
dlga_merchant_quest_2a:merchant_quest_2a_whynotcome|Why don't you come with us?
dlga_merchant_quest_2a_whynotcome:merchant_quest_2a|Because I'm paying you to go take care of it. That's the short answer. The long answer is that I've got some leads to follow up here in town, and I have just as much chance of getting knocked on my head as you, if that's what you're asking. But I respect your question. Now, what do you say?
dlga_merchant_quest_2a:close_window.1|I cannot deal with this matter at this time.
dlga_merchant_quest_3a:close_window|Very well. I go now to attack the bandits in their lair, and find your brother.
dlga_merchant_quest_3a:close_window.1|I cannot deal with this matter at this time.
dlga_start:merchant_quest_persuasion|You may do as you wish, {sir/my lady}, but I am disappointed. You would do well to reconsider. I am a rich men, and would show you my gratitude in coin.
dlga_merchant_quest_persuasion:merchant_quest_1_prologue_3|You make a persuasive case. I will help you.
dlga_merchant_quest_persuasion:merchant_quest_2|You make a persuasive case. I will help you.
dlga_merchant_quest_persuasion:merchant_quest_3|You make a persuasive case. I will help you.
dlga_merchant_quest_persuasion:merchant_quest_4b8|You make a persuasive case. I will help you.
dlga_merchant_quest_persuasion:close_window|As I say, I have more important business elsewhere.
dlga_merchant_quest_2:merchant_quest_2a|Now -- go find and defeat that group of bandits.
dlga_merchant_quest_3:merchant_quest_3a|Now -- go attack that bandit hideout, get my brother back, and show those brigands what happens to those who threaten my household.
dlga_start:close_window.67|Oh -- thank the heavens... Thank the heavens... Am I safe?
dlga_start:merchant_closing_statement_2|Ah... {playername}. Things didn't go quite so well as I had hoped. {s5} couldn't quite find it in him to overlook my little breach of the peace. Oh, he's grateful enough that I got rid of his crooked captain -- a guard who'll let in bandits will let in an enemy army, if the price is right -- but he can't exactly have me running around here as a lasting reminder of his failure to take care of things himself.
dlga_merchant_closing_statement_2:merchant_closing_statement_3|That hardly seems fair...
dlga_merchant_closing_statement_3:merchant_closing_statement_4|Fair? This is Calradia, {my boy/my lady}! Kings do what they will, and the rest of us do as they must. He didn't string me up, and instead gave me time to sell my properties -- even put in a word with the other merchants that they best pay me a fair price, too. That's gracious enough, as kings go -- but he's a weak king, as they all are here, and weak kings must always look to their authority first, and justice second. I suppose I'd do the same, in his shoes.
dlga_merchant_closing_statement_4:close_window|Anyway, I wouldn't go rubbing your part in this affair in {s5}'s face -- but he's taken note of you, and decided that you're not worth hanging, and that's something to which I'll raise a glass any day of the week. He might even have work for you, further down the road. Or, you can sell your sword to one of his competitors. Anyway, I hope you've learned a bit about what it will take to stay alive in this troubled land, and I suspect that the money you've earned won't go to waste. Good luck.
dlga_merchant_quests_last_word:close_window|I am preparing to leave town in a short while. It's been an honor to know you. Good luck.
dlga_member_intel_liaison:member_intel_liaison_results|What have you discovered?
dlga_start:member_intel_liaison|Greetings, stranger.
dlga_member_intel_liaison:close_window|It's time to pull you out. Let's leave town separately, but join me soon after
dlga_member_intel_liaison:close_window.1|You're doing good work. Stay here for a little longer, 
dlga_member_intel_liaison_results:member_intel_liaison|{s11} I notice that you have been keeping some notes about individual lords. I have annotated those with my findings.

dlga_start:close_window.69|Please do not waste any more of my time today, {sir/madame}. Perhaps we shall meet again in our travels.

dlga_minister_issues:minister_pretalk|There is a matter which needs your attention. The quarrel between {s11} and {s12} has esclatated to a point where it has become unseemly. If you do intervene, you risk offending one of the lords. However, if you do nothing, you risk appearing weak. Such are the burdens of kingship, {sire/my lady}.
dlga_minister_issues:minister_talk|{s1} currently does not have a lord. You may wish to keep it this way, as lords will sometimes gravitate towards lieges who have land to offer, but for the time being, no one is collecting any of its rents.
dlga_minister_issues:minister_talk.1|At this point, there are no particularly urgent matters which need your attention. I should point out though, sire, that I am not very skilled in the ways of politics, and that I am anxious to return to private life. If you wish to issue any but the most basic directives, I suggest appointing a trusted companion in my stead. In the meantime, is there anything you wish done?
dlga_minister_issues:minister_talk.2|If I may offer you a world of advice, my {lord/lady}, it seems that your right to rule as an independent monarch is not sufficiently recognized, and this may bring us problems further down the road. It may be advisable to find another kingdom with whom you have shared interests and seek its recognition, to establish yourself as an equal with Calradia's other kings.
dlga_minister_issues:minister_talk.3|At this point, there are no particularly urgent matters which need your attention. Is there anything you wish done?

dlga_event_triggered:companion_embassy_results|Well, {s21}, at last I've found you. I have returned from my mission to {s31}. In general, I would say, {s14}.
